page.title: 18BILLINGTON MANOR
page.content: Billington Manor stands on a site which still has ditch and bank remaining after iron age occupation. The present manor was built in the 17th century, modernized in 1881, with work still going on at the present time. The deeds granting manor rights and signed by Henry viii are retained by the present owners. The house is now divided into four parts, the main part ooccupied by the owners and three flats let with separate leases to elderly members of the family. The garden covers five acres and was neglected for many years until the present owners moved in in 1975 and started the restoration. Many trees were lost with Dutch Elm disease and the shrubbery suffered through neglect. Now a tree surgeon regularly attends to the remaining trees.
